question: In advanced nursing practice, evidence-based guidelines should always override clinical judgment.
Which electrolyte imbalance is most associated with peaked T waves on an ECG?
The normal range for intracranial pressure (ICP) in adults is ____ mmHg.
Nurse practitioners are legally permitted to independently diagnose, treat, and prescribe in every U.S. state.
Which of the following is the first-line treatment for septic shock according to current guidelines?
The drug of choice for treating anaphylaxis is ____.
Continuous bladder irrigation is typically indicated after transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP).
Which oxygen delivery device provides the highest concentration of oxygen?
The antidote for opioid overdose is ____.
A patient with diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) typically presents with metabolic acidosis and Kussmaul respirations.
Which of the following interventions has the highest priority for a patient with acute pulmonary edema?
The therapeutic serum level range for digoxin is ____ ng/mL.
In advanced nursing, arterial blood gas (ABG) analysis is primarily used to assess oxygenation and acid-base balance.
Which of the following is a common complication of central venous catheter insertion?
The primary medication class used to treat acute decompensated heart failure is ________.
Advanced practice nurses can independently prescribe controlled substances in all U.S. states.
What is the most appropriate initial intervention for a patient experiencing anaphylaxis?
The Glasgow Coma Scale assesses eye opening, verbal response, and ________ response.
Mechanical ventilation is contraindicated in patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
Which electrolyte imbalance is most commonly associated with digoxin toxicity?
The term for inflammation of the pericardium is ________.
Nurse practitioners must collaborate with physicians for all patient care decisions.
In managing diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA), the initial fluid replacement should be with:
The antidote for heparin overdose is ________.
Palliative care focuses solely on end-of-life treatment.
Which of the following is a sign of increased intracranial pressure?
The primary nursing intervention for a patient with pulmonary embolism is ________ therapy.
Advanced directives are legally binding in all healthcare settings.
What is the gold standard diagnostic test for confirming myocardial infarction?
The condition characterized by low platelet count, prolonged bleeding time, and hemolytic anemia is ________.
Telehealth services require in-person verification for all prescriptions.
Which medication is commonly used as a reversal agent for benzodiazepine overdose?
The Braden Scale is used to assess risk for ________ ulcers.
Evidence-based practice in nursing excludes patient preferences.
In sepsis management, the Surviving Sepsis Campaign recommends fluid resuscitation with at least:
The hormone responsible for milk ejection reflex is ________.
All advanced practice nurses are required to hold a doctoral degree.
Which of the following is an indicator of hypovolemic shock?
The diagnostic criteria for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) often include a positive ________ test.
Continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT) is used for stable patients only.
What is the primary goal of thrombolytic therapy in acute ischemic stroke?
The class of antibiotics most associated with Clostridioides difficile infection is ________.
Interprofessional collaboration improves patient outcomes in advanced nursing practice.
Which assessment tool is used for delirium in ICU patients?
The term for abnormal accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity is ________.
Nurse anesthetists can administer anesthesia without physician supervision in some states.
In advanced wound care, negative pressure wound therapy is indicated for:
The primary symptom of compartment syndrome is severe ________.
Quality improvement projects in nursing must always involve randomized controlled trials.
Which of the following is a key component of the ABCDE bundle for ICU liberation?
The genetic condition causing progressive muscle weakness is ________ dystrophy.
Advanced nursing roles include research and policy development.
What is the recommended INR range for patients on warfarin for atrial fibrillation?
The inflammation of the meninges is called ________.
